text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^3 \rightarrow \mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] be a linear transformation with standard matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline]. Suppose the columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] are linearly independent. Which of the following must be true? Click all that apply.

choice.text: The equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 3 \\ 5 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline] has exactly one solution
[mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] row reduces to the identity matrix

font.p: The matrix equation stated above has a solution because [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is onto, and it has a unique solution because [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is into. The other parts of the answer are directly from the IMT.
